## Expectation.toReferentiallyEqual() method

Performs a referential equality check using `Object.is`<!-- -->. It is similar to `===`<!-- -->, with two differences:

1. `Object.is(-0, +0)` returns `false` 2. `Object.is(NaN, NaN)` returns `true`

This function should be used if you care about object identity rather than deep equality.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
toReferentiallyEqual(this: Expectation<T>, value: T): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  this | [Expectation](./earljs.expectation.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt; |  |
|  value | T | value to check against. |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
